Transcription for 547605

Tadea, Lord, I still hear one,
I hear one, I hear one,
Tadea, Lord, I still hear one,
I hear one, I hear one,
O God, who live and love me,
Seek me through my whole, whole being.
Tadea, the Inland's God in heart,
I see him going with prayer.
Tadea, Lord, I hear how well-bound,
How near and far he came.
O God, who live and love me,
How near and far, O God, I breathe.
Amen, amen, amen.
Amen.
O thou that gave the magic calm,
And sunset beauty bright,
O thou that hits the spring adorned,
And gave it song and light,
O wonder, Lord, each day we snore,
And love thy beat that passeth o'er.
Amen, amen, amen.
Amen.
